means: 猛烈地燃烧( blaze的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The rioters barricaded streets with piles of blazing tyres.
sentence.Network_cn: 暴徒用一堆堆燃烧的轮胎在大街上筑起了路障。

sentence.Network_en: My husband has just had a blazing row with his boss.
sentence.Network_cn: 我丈夫刚和他老板大吵了一架。

sentence.Network_en: Miss Turner turned blazing eyes on the victim.
sentence.Network_cn: 特纳小姐无比同情地看着受害者。

entry.def: Blazing sun or blazing hot weather is very hot.

example.ex: Quite a few people were eating outside in the blazing sun.
example.tran: 不少人在外面的炎炎烈日下吃饭。

example.ex: ...freezing cold winters and blazing hot summers.

entry.def: When people have a blazing row, they quarrel in a very noisy and excited way.

example.ex: My husband has just had a blazing row with his boss.
example.tran: 我丈夫刚和他老板大吵了一架。

means.word_mean: 1. a strong flame that burns brightly;
2. lighted up by or as by fire or flame;
3. without any attempt at concealment; completely obvious;

auth_sentence.content: Through Heav'n, That open'd wide her blazing Portals.
auth_sentence.res_content: Through Heav'n, That open'd wide her blazing Portals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Through Heav'n, That open'd wide her blazing Portals.

auth_sentence.content: Her intense animal face was blazing with health and vitality and feral curiosity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her intense animal face was blazing with health and vitality and feral curiosity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her intense animal face was blazing with health and vitality and feral curiosity.

auth_sentence.content: Midday sunlight, blazing on the roof of the cabin, grilled the air inside.
auth_sentence.res_content: Midday sunlight, blazing on the roof of the cabin, grilled the air inside.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Midday sunlight, blazing on the roof of the cabin, grilled the air inside.
